repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: health can not shown in a floating window
Solution: add g:health variable

![QQ_1730807070970](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/19c6aeb2-27c6-47db-8fe0-307d60c7bc0f)

comment_data.body:
I think we've discussed a `:float` or `:popup` command that works like `:split` and `:tab`. Don't want a health-specific special case here.

Meanwhile to unblock this pr, for now we could support a `vim.g.health = { style = 'float' }` option.
can we re-use the lsp floating window util? maybe extract it to a private `vim._util` module for now.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -331,13 +331,24 @@ function M._check(mods, plugin_names)
 
   local emptybuf = vim.fn.bufnr('$') == 1 and vim.fn.getline(1) == '' and 1 == vim.fn.line('$')
 
-  -- When no command modifiers are used:
-  -- - If the current buffer is empty, open healthcheck directly.
-  -- - If not specified otherwise open healthcheck in a tab.
-  local buf_cmd = #mods > 0 and (mods .. ' sbuffer') or emptybuf and 'buffer' or 'tab sbuffer'
-
   local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(true, true)
-  vim.cmd(buf_cmd .. ' ' .. bufnr)
+  if #mods > 0 and mods == 'float' then

comment_data.body:
i have also consider a modifier like `float` but i think this can be done after previewpopup merge. use  ++ is not a good option.  user has to type ++f every time in cmdline. An option to fix it is good. maybe like
` if type(vim.g.health) == 'table' and vim.tbl_get(vim.g.health, 'style') == 'float' then` how ?
`vim.lsp.open_floating_preview` take content and create float seems like not fit here
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -331,13 +331,24 @@ function M._check(mods, plugin_names)
 
   local emptybuf = vim.fn.bufnr('$') == 1 and vim.fn.getline(1) == '' and 1 == vim.fn.line('$')
 
-  -- When no command modifiers are used:
-  -- - If the current buffer is empty, open healthcheck directly.
-  -- - If not specified otherwise open healthcheck in a tab.
-  local buf_cmd = #mods > 0 and (mods .. ' sbuffer') or emptybuf and 'buffer' or 'tab sbuffer'
-
   local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(true, true)
-  vim.cmd(buf_cmd .. ' ' .. bufnr)
+  if #mods > 0 and mods == 'float' then

comment_data.body: `contents` is just used to guess the window size. we can just pass the healthcheck contents, what's the problem? Though healthcheck contents technically are not markdown, but that doesn't matter. (Also, I think we might want checkhealth to use markdown in the future)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -331,13 +331,24 @@ function M._check(mods, plugin_names)
 
   local emptybuf = vim.fn.bufnr('$') == 1 and vim.fn.getline(1) == '' and 1 == vim.fn.line('$')
 
-  -- When no command modifiers are used:
-  -- - If the current buffer is empty, open healthcheck directly.
-  -- - If not specified otherwise open healthcheck in a tab.
-  local buf_cmd = #mods > 0 and (mods .. ' sbuffer') or emptybuf and 'buffer' or 'tab sbuffer'
-
   local bufnr = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(true, true)
-  vim.cmd(buf_cmd .. ' ' .. bufnr)
+  if #mods > 0 and mods == 'float' then

comment_data.body: why would this be overridable? checkhealth has its own filetype, people can extend that in the usual ways.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -21,6 +21,23 @@ To run all healthchecks, use: >vim
 <
 Plugin authors are encouraged to write new healthchecks. |health-dev|
 
+                                                                    *g:health*
+g:health  This global variable controls the behavior and appearance of the
+          `health` floating window. It should be a dictionary containing the
+          following optional keys:
+          - `style`: string? Determines the display style of the `health` window.
+                            Set to `'float'` to enable a floating window. Other
+                            styles are not currently supported.
+          - `syntax`: string? Specifies the syntax highlighting to use

comment_data.body:
Don't need this if we get https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/31074 , right?

For now, let's just choose a default border when `style=float`. Probably whatever the default was for `:LspInfo`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -21,6 +21,23 @@ To run all healthchecks, use: >vim
 <
 Plugin authors are encouraged to write new healthchecks. |health-dev|
 
+                                                                    *g:health*
+g:health  This global variable controls the behavior and appearance of the
+          `health` floating window. It should be a dictionary containing the
+          following optional keys:
+          - `style`: string? Determines the display style of the `health` window.
+                            Set to `'float'` to enable a floating window. Other
+                            styles are not currently supported.
+          - `syntax`: string? Specifies the syntax highlighting to use
+                            for the content of the `health` window.
+                            Defaults to an empty string if not provided.
+          - `border`: (string|table) Configures the border style of the floating window.

@@ -21,6 +21,23 @@ To run all healthchecks, use: >vim
 <
 Plugin authors are encouraged to write new healthchecks. |health-dev|
 
+                                                                    *g:health*
+g:health  This global variable controls the behavior and appearance of the
+          `health` floating window. It should be a dictionary containing the
+          following optional keys:

+                            Set to `'float'` to enable a floating window. Other

+                            for the content of the `health` window.
+                            Defaults to an empty string if not provided.
+          - `border`: (string|table) Configures the border style of the floating window.

   given title if found

comment_data.body:
doesn't `pos` conflict with `relative`? it can't be relative to cursor but also centered...

let's add `center` to `relative` and drop `pos`?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2034,7 +2034,8 @@ Lua module: vim.lsp.util                                            *lsp-util*
       â€¢ {zindex}?        (`integer`) override `zindex`, defaults to 50
       â€¢ {title}?         (`string`)
       â€¢ {title_pos}?     (`'left'|'center'|'right'`)
-      â€¢ {relative}?      (`'mouse'|'cursor'`) (default: `'cursor'`)
+      â€¢ {pos}?           (`'center'`)
+      â€¢ {relative}?      (`'mouse'|'cursor'|'editor'`) (default: `'cursor'`)

comment_data.body: I think relative in there is same as relative in nvim_open_win. in nvim_open_win there is no center

comment_data.body: removed.  just use offset to make it center

comment_data.body: Want to avoid surface area where possible. max_height/width should be dropped for now. Just choose something reasonable.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -21,6 +21,19 @@ To run all healthchecks, use: >vim
 <
 Plugin authors are encouraged to write new healthchecks. |health-dev|
 
+                                                                    *g:health*
+g:health  This global variable controls the behavior and appearance of the
+          `health` floating window. It should be a dictionary containing the
+          following optional keys:
+          - `style`: string? Determines the display style of the `health` window.
+                            Set to `'float'` to enable a floating window. Other
+                            styles are not currently supported.
+          - `max_height`: integer? Max height of floating window
+          - `max_width`: integer? Max width of floating window

comment_data.body: Just thought some people might have some fixed settings for height and width.  cleaned up

comment_data.body:
IMO we should use lua syntax for new docs

```suggestion
          Example: >lua
	    vim.g.health = { style = 'float' }
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -21,6 +21,17 @@ To run all healthchecks, use: >vim
 <
 Plugin authors are encouraged to write new healthchecks. |health-dev|
 
+                                                                    *g:health*
+g:health  This global variable controls the behavior and appearance of the
+          `health` floating window. It should be a dictionary containing the
+          following optional keys:
+          - `style`: string? Determines the display style of the `health` window.
+                            Set to `'float'` to enable a floating window. Other
+                            styles are not currently supported.
+
+          Example: >vim
+            let g:health = { 'style': 'float' }

comment_data.body: This is a temporary hack until we have `:help preview-popup` or possibly a `:float` modifier. https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/31902
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -21,6 +21,17 @@ To run all healthchecks, use: >vim
 <
 Plugin authors are encouraged to write new healthchecks. |health-dev|
 
+                                                                    *g:health*
+g:health  This global variable controls the behavior and appearance of the
+          `health` floating window. It should be a dictionary containing the
+          following optional keys:
+          - `style`: string? Determines the display style of the `health` window.

comment_regular_data.body: Worth documenting that `q` closes the checkhealth buffer for the float version but not regular version or do we consider this implied?
That was already changed (`q` closes buffer on master)...

Except this PR unchanges it so that `q` doesn't close the non-float version of checkhealth anymore, but does close the float version. I was more thinking if this difference in behavior is worth documenting, but probably not.
Ah, that's a a merge fail then. I don't think that's intended.

You don't think? I assumed this is intended, since it treats the non-float checkhealth as a regular buffer but the float version as a "float" buffer that can be closed with `q` as with lsp hovers. I think this change makes sense. I'll go ahead and approve it because I like this lol

> You don't think?

Given the timing (float PR from November, buffer change this week) and the fact that float is opt-in, I don't. Could be wrong, of course -- @justinmk will set things straight.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(health): support show health in floating window
